main event: On April 11, 1957, a round, white object the size of a baseball was observed for 15-20 seconds traveling at great speed from 180 degrees to position directly overhead, where it dissipated in a shower of red sparks. No trail or exhaust was observed.
interesting points: The object was described as round, white, and the size of a baseball when held at arm's length.
It traveled at great speed and dissipated in a shower of red sparks directly overhead.
No trail or exhaust was observed, indicating a unique behavior.
The observation lasted 15-20 seconds, providing a relatively long duration for the sighting.
The conclusion was that the object was a fireball, with insufficient data for further evaluation.
sighted object: round, white object the size of a baseball
